comments.body: Wrong category.
There's several spooky elements in the overworld, not even listed in that post. Also, the other dimensions are supposed to be scarier than the overworld.

Ambient sounds.

This is not feedback nor a suggestion.
Unsure that they'd want to separate the tracks vs treating all soundtrack as part of MC, but there are mods/datapacks available for personal preference of only C418 tracks.
I would agree, but it's too long of a message...
by mini I mean like play short bits of the disc
that's why there is sound options and being able to see the green bar in your inventory slot. we dont need all these filler ideas on feedback.

Hi! Please see translation below  :)

 

‎The sound of the horn ‎

‎The goat horn does not reproduce the sound in this new version part 1 of Minecraft‎
 
-Translated by admin
No
no

mojang isnt gonna add copyright-infringing music for a meme that's been dead quite a while now just because you said "please".

it would be incredibly costly for Mojang to buy (and constantly renew) the license to the song for almost no return on the investment.
Ok thanks. I’m posting here on behalf of my 7 year old autistic MineCraft fan. I’ll pass on your responses.
Able to change the volume of EACH SOUND?! The current sound options is already massive for a game
wtf?

Please be sure to also add your thoughts to our V3 Texture thread in Graphics !

Thanks for your contribution.
Oh absolutely, this would help with Blazes sniping you from afar without you even hearing or seeing them

please don't take away the old Og piston sound if you want to silence pistons just make it so you can craft one with a wool block to silence it. The piston sound is what makes redstone builds cool and why take it away when there are better ways to get it silenced and wool already blocks vibrations. Please consider this it would be easy to code in and every one will be happy! Thanks
Another solution would be to keep the old piston sound, but also include a piston volume slider somewhere so we can decide how loud it is.

I feel like having to manually wax the pistons might get annoying (especially if you ended up having to spend forever searching for the one piston unwaxed piston in your door/flying-machine/farm/whatever) and having them check whether or not they're waxed every time they get triggered might create a bit of lag. Maybe it would be better to make craftable silenced pistons (and sticky silenced pistons) that act as a separate block with their own texture
I feel like a better solution would be to keep the old piston sound, but also include a piston volume slider somewhere so we can decide how loud it is.
Honestly, the piston noise went from loud and annoying to wet and soft. Hearing that all the time would make me uncomfortable. The new sound is too moist.
Mybe if the cave sound sound less frequently... It maybe could be perfect
Stop being a child and grow up.
idk man, the cave ambience 1 sound kinda gives me goosebumps
If they would only mimic sounds of hostile mobs then how would that make any sense that they wouldn't be able to do that for other mobs?
The Parrots are useful and if you have a problem with their mimicking ability, then just take down your mob volume. That way they can be less irritating to you.

They'd only mimic hostile mobs because they'd know that they're the only ones we want to hear.  Also, turning down the game sound isn't worth it because then you can't here the other beautiful sounds.

That still doesn't make any sense. Parrots making sounds of just hostile mobs just because they know that that's the only sounds that we want to hear still doesn't give enough reasoning of why they should only mimic hostile mobs. They're a living creature and they are free of what they want to do. It's life. We don't give them orders of what they should and shouldn't be mimicking. Also you said in you're post that and I quote, "It happens to be that the mimicking sounds parrots make are REALLY ANNOYING, especially that of zombies." Zombies are a hostile mob. So if you're saying that they should only mimic hostile mobs but Zombies are a hostile mob, how would that make any sense?
I also suggested "...parrots should only mimic hostile mobs and their mimicking noises should be much quieter."

Okay but that still doesn't explain why you want them to mimic only hostile mobs but in your post you said, "It happens to be that the mimicking sounds parrots make are REALLY ANNOYING, especially that of zombies." Zombies are a hostile mob!

I don't agree on making the sounds much quieter because then you may miss out on more important ones when adventuring around at night. Instead, how about we have the parrot only mimick mobs within viewing distance? That way it doesn't mimic anything we can't see or don't have direct access to. This would help when keeping parrots in the safety of our home, that it doesn't end up being our worst mistake ever because it keeps mimicking a random mob that is safe in a super-specific spot or mimic mobs in a nearby mob-farm.
Yeah my friend has parrots in Minecraft and they drive me insane they’re constantly making every single mob noise

seriously!! in one of my worlds, i really wanted my house to be in a jungle so i went to one. at the same time, i also decided i wanted a pet parrot but i kept getting really creeped out cuz i kept hearing, what i thought to be, baby zombies. it sounded really close so i kept looking around, and nothing. i ended up deleting that world cuz it made me go so delirious trying to find the "zombie" that i got killed by a creeper. i ended up figuring out that it was, indeed, the birds making the sounds after i made a new world and spawned in the jungle.
Please get rid of this feature, I love having birds around but the mob noises are so annoying I've literally gotten blown up by creepers because I thought it was my bird

Either make the mimic sounds quieter, or better yet, just decrease the frequency of their idle sounds. Even when they aren't imitating things, they make noise constantly. I don't think there's any good reason to remove any aspect of the feature, it just needs to be toned down a little.

ive ended up killing every parrot ive ever tamed in the game, they really are irritating, often making noises of mobs that are no where to be found. i wish there was a way to toggle it bc if my indoor parrot is warning me of a creeper, if it’s actually there it’s too late, if it’s not then it’s a pointless scare.

cant turn down my friendly mob sound bc i want to hear my sheep and my dogs ive had 3 parrots all 3 spammed like 3 mob sounds a moment pretty annoying tbh they're all dead now as if you make the sound of my enemy you are my enemy but yeah id love to see a way to make then stop especially in bedrock where they can spam hostile mob sounds to the point where its not funny or anything just straight annoying imagine the sound of a mob grinder and that entire sound is made by like 3 parrots

as someone who lives fairly close to a mob spawn, i had to put my birds on my roof (very tall) so i could be in my house without hearing mobs. my suggestion would be to just decrease how far they mimic. more specifically on the y cord. i dont care to hear about a mob 20 blocks under me
Highly unlikely, it's all MC music now. Just use a resource pack or outside music playing sources.
Please, original music is one of minecrafts most important elements. Mediocre new tracks are just watering down the expirience and anoying old players...
I think that the newer soundtracks are good and fit the game.

Can't stand it either to be honest. But this is matter of taste, experience,a and sensitivity, each of us has different.

What keeps us away from being happy is just a minor customization, very simple code of piece required, a cheap flag and a toggle. I bet this would make many players of the original game delighted - something like "legacy/nostalgia music only" toggle.

This wouldn't hurt fans of new music either. Just one flag, one customization... would certainly make some of us, older players less alienated with current development of the game!

I think they fit the game a lot and I prefer a lot of them to some of C418s tracks particularly all of Aaron Cherofs tracks. Out of all of the newest ones, I can only think of one that isn’t that good, it’s not terrible though

hater lol

i do like the old music, but if you only want the older music may i suggest playing an older version? it's very easy and also doesn't include all of the other crap they've added over the years

this is the reason that i play in both 1.8.9 and 1.20.4
it wouldn't be an issue with me if the tracks could easily be removed entirely instead of having to settle for resource packs that make the audio silent or repeat another track.
this is a you problem lol. the new lena tracks and trails and tales tracks are just as good as the old music and your garbage rose tinted nostalgia glasses are ruining it for you.

Looking through the comments on this, the people who disagree are missing the point. The new music is technically fine but a huge part of Minecraft's identity came from C418's original vision. Microsoft stopped working with him because he didn't want to lose ownership of the original tracks. The classic tracks are one person's unique vision. The new ones are just generic commissions from admittedly talented musicians. You can hear the lack of passion in the music itself. I just started playing Minecraft again for the first time in a while and I like some of the new tracks, specifically the stuff for the nether but some of the songs that come on in the overworld make me physically cringe when I hear them. There's too much overt emotion.
YES! I had this exact same idea. This would be a cool throwback to long time players.
I also had this idea because personally I think it would be a neat sort of easter egg to remind long term players of the classic damage noise.

Yes, I think this feature has been long overdue. It seems weird that the Netherworld, and even Caves have ambiance, but the Overworld is eerily silent. This feature obviously isn't for everyone, but ambient biome noise could be turned up or down like any other sound setting. ...Not so sure how I feel about fog though. Maybe just different sky colors, like the nether? (Slightly lighter blue for mountains, slightly yellower for deserts, etc.)

Full support for ambient sound though: What better way to add ambiance to existing biomes than... literal ambiance?
I've wanted this for so long in the game, I think that the forest is the one that should have much more of these sounds because it is the most seen biome
This would be a great change! And this is effectively already a thing for the nether biomes, so yeah, why not the overworld, too?
thats what i've always wanted.

I really like this idea, especially for the overworld. The nether has some very well done environmental noises that immerse you into the biome you are in. The emptiness and quietness of the overworld makes it feel so lonely, and almost terrifying as your brain would expect some noises coming from a busy world filled with living things. Minecraft would be so much more welcoming and immersive if the overworld got some biome-specific ambiance added.
"why do I hear boss music"

If anything, the boss music should be atmospheric, like the arch-Illager theme If It were abit more calm, yet still being very Intense, and If they compose It right, It could really go on par with the funky, Intense beats of megalovania.
YEAH GO LENA
Mojang should really consider this.

I fully agree. Currently the bell is quieter than a note block. While it might sound louder up close the sound doesn't travel as far, which doesn't make sense since it's a warning bell. It should be heard from further away.
I agree the bell is about 1ft. wide so it should make a very loud, long ringing sound.

I am actually quite indifferent to the new sound for the piston, but I really like your suggestion for Mojang to add an option to revert it--along with other sounds that have been modified or replaced--back to their originals. This change is quite minor in the grand scheme of things, but holding onto these sounds for future updates can help familiarize players from past and current generations with a blend of "classic" and "modern" Minecraft without the need to resort to downgrading your update. Being given the choice to mix-and-match like this would be a brilliant feature to have readily available in a sandbox game such as this one.
Tbh, it didn't even need to be that much quieter. Lowering it by like 15% would probably be good enough

I'd say that the block, which the new one is being placed on should play the impact sound of falling onto it. That's generally a much softer sound than the place sound and it would be less confusing to, for example, hear a creak of wood behind the sound of placing wooden planks against wooden planks instead of having either just a weirdly amplified block placing sound or a stuttery echo effect, which would happen if you just played a quieter block placing sound for the block being placed against.
